title: Two vessels A and B contain milk and water in the ratio 7 : 5 and 17 : 7 respectively. In what ratio mixtures from two vessels should be mixed to get a new mixture containing milk and water in the ratio 5 : 3? - Quora

response.answer_text: in the new vessel we have milk 7/12(5/8) + 17/24(3/8) = X part of milk X = 121/192 water 5/12(5/8) + 7/24(3/8) = X part of water X = 121/192 New ratio= 1:1
Milk in Vessel A=7/12 Milk in Vessel B=17/24 Mean (Ratio required):5:3 or Milk 5/8 17/24-5/8=2/24 : 5/8 -7/12=1/24 Hence they should be mixed in the ratio of A:B=2:1 to get the new ratio.
